intro: Cnidium grossheimii, commonly known as the Japanese cnidium, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic, often pungent, foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring finely divided leaves and small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels. Its rhizomes and roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or shaded areas.
